Key Match Events: Brazil's forward Rodrygo scored the only goal of the match during the 2026 FIFA World Cup South American qualifiers football match between Brazil and Ecuador.
Rodrygo's goal came in the 29th minute, with his effort deflecting off a defender and hitting the right post before finding the back of the net.
Defender Gabriel Magalhaes denied Moises Caicedo's effort with a last-minute goal-line clearance right before the break.
Post-Match Reflections: Rodrygo expressed his happiness with the victory and his goal, stating that the win was necessary and he hopes it helps the team progress to the level they want to reach moving forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil dominated possession but failed to create clear chances throughout the match.
Ecuador applied physically aggressive pressure, making it difficult for Brazil to get inside their box and forcing them to resort to long-range strikes.
Brazil's performance was lackluster, with only two shots on target in the first half and a single shot on target in the second half.
The match was played at the Major Antônio Couto Pereira stadium in Curitiba, Brazil.
